posts.content:
Hey guys! A little intro about the server I play on:
Mostly it's rp and it is pretty restricted so it's not power game-y, I believe if you work hard for it, getting to level 40 is gonna take like a year.

I kinda thought a barbarian would be cool and I wanted it to be an Orc for cool rp purposes but I think a human sucks a lot less mechanically. They just use the half-orc race and then apply a skin (that is green and not permanent so that sucks) so I get +2 str and -2 wis if I go orc on top of the half-orc bonus. Anyways, this build is PvM, there are restrictions on my server being that if you want to multiclass, there must be 5 levels of a class before I hit epic levels. Certain classes have class restrictions and they can't freely multiclass which are, Monk, Paladin and Druid I believe maybe Cleric too because of religion / alignment reasons. It's also low-magic so the best gear is +3. A shield is prety necessary if you want to survive solo and there's really no way to make up that lost AC. I really don't know how some people do it on the server but two handers have it kind of hard.  Pretty much defensive tank is what I had in mind and yeah, please take a look! Oh also some feat changes I remember are, devastating crit has a 30str requirement and overwhelming crit doesn't stack with thundering rage. No keen weapons either. I'm just looking for a way to make it mechanically better. Should I maybe mutliclass into fighter and then WM or something? That will definitely give me more feats / more damage if I PrC into WM but I am not sure on build. Also not too sure on the skillpoints either. Heal is maxed because the healing kits heal you for hp based off of your healing skill. Maybe I should throw some in spellcraft? Feats wise I kind of wanted Improved Knockdown because it's pretty nice but not sure how to fit it in. Blind fight is pretty mandatory. I was thinking of using a Warhammer as a 1-hander so not really sure if improved critical is good or not. Maybe a different weapon is better? Just take a look and any feedback is greatly appreciated!

Edit: Oh forgot to add, we don't have a Champion of Torm or Blackguards and most prestige classes are gated through heavy rp requirements and the only one not is the weaponmaster really.

How about this build? It has 1 more AB (from Epic Prowess) and 3 more AC (from heavy armor) than your build. The ability bonuses increase on even numbers, so I have all the abilites end on even numbers, while you had 4 of them end on odd. The extra attack from Cleave is really nice early on when you only have 1 attack per round. I moved Armor Skin earlier at the expense of bumping EDR to later because it is better to not get hit than to take a little bit less damage per hit. You might also consider moving Epic Prowess earlier on the premise that they can't attack you if they're already dead. Improved Critical is good for a warhammer because it doubles the frequency of your criticals, which have a x3 multiplier on them. If you prefer, you can replace Lightning Reflexes with Improved Expertise. Click the word Spoiler to see the build.

posts.content:
Oh wow thanks guys. I've much to think upon.
The build by Empyre is more along the lines of what I wanted, thanks a bunch! The reason I ended a lot of my ability scores on an even number was just due to the fact I wanted certain feats but you kind of solved that for me. No Thundering Rage though but I might just replace it with Eic Prowess like you said as 5% to hit osmething more is probably nicer than getting a cool massive crit bonus if it means I don't hit anything at all. Also thanks for rearranging the atrriutes / feats for leveling urposes because that totally went over my head as I just looked at the end game which I probably wouldn't reach anytime soon hah!
The build by Mick Dagger is actually super awesome! I haven't thought of using rogue and I think it really fits with that half-orc "grrr I smash" feel since he forgoes the EDR and goes for huge strength. Unfortunately my server doesn't allow half anythings (aside from halflings) and I'd have to go full orc, which I kind of wanted to do anyway and got to +2 wis because of our rule about not having more than two attributes lower than 8 and only one at 8 and one at 6 after the orc skin gets applied the wisdom will be -2 so it'll end up with a 6 wis 6 cha so that's not gonna fly. 

Dang, these are really awesome, one with more survivability and one with more smash and skillpoints. Thanks for all the insight!
